instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera not detected - liquid damage
threads.message:
Slight liquid damage, after clean all working fine except the camera. 

Diagnostic says there may be an issue with the camera. Not sure if that means detected by problematic signals or not detected at all.
Not detected under System Report


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM</SIGNAL> - 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL> - 5.1V
ALS seems to be responding - adjusting screen and kbd bcklt brightness

Checked L4007/09/10 coils seem to be fine
L3901/2/3/4 - voltages are correct
No physical/liquid damage around any of those
Slight liquid discolouration around <CAPACITOR>C3928</CAPACITOR> of <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>, but voltages seem fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera not detected - liquid damage
threads.message: Test first with known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera not detected - liquid damage
threads.message: I should have mentioned it. Still not detected with a known good assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera not detected - liquid damage
threads.message:
Possibly <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> affected by corrosion.
Did you check L4080-85 too (page 37)?
Do you get all power lines from page 36?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera not detected - liquid damage
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3900</CHIP> is underfilled chip, cant reflow. Poked the components around which are not underfilled and seem to be solid. 
Did continuity test on those L4080-85 too, also no corrosion in the area. 

<SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL> - 1.39V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL> - 1.78V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL> - 1.20V
PP1V2_CAM_XTALPCIEVDD - 1.19V
<SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.28V
<SIGNAL>CAM_TEST_OUT</SIGNAL> - 1.285-1.289V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Camera not detected - liquid damage
threads.message: Check trace continuity between all camera components, until J8500.
